description.p: The double scimitar is the signature weapon of the Silverstand Bladesingers. A haft of fine wood supports a long blade on either end. Forged with techniques honed over tens of thousands of years, these blades are strong, sharp, and remarkably light. Each scimitar is a masterpiece, and as a result the double scimitar is an expensive weapon, but few people ever have an opportunity to purchase one.

Special. When you take the attack action and make a two-handed attack with a double-bladed scimitar, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the blade at the opposite end of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d4, and it deals slashing damage.
T
Form of the Swaying Willow: When you take the dodge action, you can choose not to be affected by any forced movement or attempt to cause you to be prone.
Form of the Rising Wind: Your unarmed attacks now have a range of 20 ft.
Form of the Leech: When you incapacitate a target or critically hit you regain 1 ki point.
Form of the Flying Dragon: Once per turn, if you move at least 20 ft in a straight line and attack, you deal an additional damage equal to your martial arts die.
Form of the Spirit: Your unarmed strikes deal force damage, and can target creatures on the ethereal plane.
Form of Flowing Strikes: Once per turn, if you miss with an attack you may make a free unarmed attack on a target within 5 ft.

Form of the Leaping Cricket: You can add your Dexterity modifier to the heigh of your High Jump (in addition to your Strength modifier). You can use your Dexterity score instead of your Strength for calculating your Long Jump distance.

Deja Fu: Once per long rest, on your turn you can attempt three different simultaneous scenarios. Each turn much have a different action. Once all three turns are complete and dice have been rolled, you must choose which one of these turns to enact into reality.

id-00003.name: Bracers of a Thousand Forms
id-00003.nonidentified: Bracers made of a finely woven fabric covered with intricate patterns

description.p: This silken cloth is enchanted using a unique blend of abjuration and evocation magic, allowing it to be used for a number of purposes. At any one time it can be one of four colors: red, yellow, green, or blue. You can change the Chromacloth's color using an action on your turn to one of these four colors.

The cloth can be fashioned to be an effective sling: dealing damage as a sling normally would, but changing the damage type of the ammunition to match the sling's color. Refer to the table below for a reference of the Chromacloth's associated damage types:

The bladestaff is the signature weapon of the Silverstand Bladesingers. A long haft of fine wood supports a curved elven blade. Forged with techniques honed over tens of thousands of years, these blades are strong, sharp, and remarkably light. Each bladestaff is a masterpiece, and as a result this an expensive weapon, but few people ever have an opportunity to purchase one.
In darkness, the unsheathed blade of this weapon sheds moonlight, creating bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.

id-00007.name: Elven Bladestaff
id-00007.nonidentified: This weapon seems to sparkle with light

description.p: The head of this heavy forging hammer is persistently red hot. The hammer deals an extra 1d4 fire damage.

When you hit a creature with the hammer, you can immediately cast the heat metal spell (DC 13) targeting an object it's holding or wearing. For the spell's duration, the hammer's head goes cold and does not deal extra fire damage. Once the spell has been cast, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

id-00012.name: Lavaforge
id-00012.nonidentified: The head of this heavy forging hammer glows red hot.

description.p: Song Craft. Whenever this weapon is used to strike a foe, its bearer hears a fragment of an ancient song in a language they almost recognise.

Of the Sea. If this weapon is not immersed in salt water at least once every 3 days, it loses all magic properties and becomes a normal axe until it is reimmersed. In addition, its bearer has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to swim.

id-00014.name: Leviathan's Cutback
id-00014.nonidentified:
Leviathan's Cutback is a practical, but vicious looking axe. The axe head is a dark grey steel with a slight mottling to the cast. It is engraved with eldritch runes that pulsate with inner blue light. As you watch, the runes shift and ripple in your vision as if you're looking at them underwater.

No matter how long you're away from water, this wicked looking axe looks like it's just emerged from the sea - with drops of salty water constantly falling from the blade.

description.p: This dagger has 3 charges. It regains all expended charges daily at dawn.
When you use your action to throw this dagger, but before it hits, you may use your bonus action to expend one of the charges and cast Misty Step targeting the dagger's location.
You emerge holding the dagger, and if the target is a creature, you emerge adjacent to the target. If you miss with the attack, the DM determines where you teleport to.

id-00016.name: Mist Dagger
id-00016.nonidentified: This dagger has a distinctive pattern of banding and mottling reminiscent of flowing water. Condensed water constantly drips from the blade.

description.p: Siege weapon: This weapon does maximum damage against man-made, inanimate objects.

Sunder Rune. As an action, you can slam this axe into an object or the ground, causing the effect of the shatter spell centered on yourself. The save DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier, however you automatically fail the save. Once this rune has been activated, roll a d6. On a result of 1-4, it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

id-00025.name: Sunder
id-00025.nonidentified: The attention to detail and the materials used mark this weapon out as special.

id-00028.description:
Description
These vicious Talons are crafted by the Sea Reaver clan, a small group of renegade Goliath who prowl the Azure Sea. Made from armour ripped off fallen foes, then engraved with runes of eldritch power, the talons make the clan's hunters and trackers a force to be reckoned with, on both land and sea.
While wearing the Talons of the Hunter you gain the following benefits:
While equipped, this armguard acts as a shield, but only provides a +1 bonus to AC
This armguard can be used with Versatile and Heavy weapons to make two-handed strikes
Your unarmed strikes made with the talons deal slashing damage, use a 1d4 for damage and count as magical.
When you're raging and use the Attack action, you can use a bonus action to attack with the talons.
The armguard has 4 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.
Spells. You can use an action to expend 1 or more of the armguard's charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using a DC 15 spell save: Snare (1 charge), Camouflage (1 charge), Hunter's Mark (2 charges).
In addition you can cast Locate Animals or Plants as a ritual without expending any charges.
Spell: Hunter's Mark Spell: Snare Spell: Camouflage Ritual: Locate Animals or Plants
id-00028.name: Talons of the Hunter
id-00028.nonidentified: This armguard appears to be made from scavenged plate armour, and is obviously intended for larger humanoids. It covers your left (or right) arm from the shoulder down with a series of metallic plates, and ends in a vicious clawed gauntlet. Each plate is carved with runes that appear to be Giant-like in origin.

description.p: This weapon is designed to be used as a focus to channel your Eldritch Blast. If you don't have the Eldritch Blast cantrip you cannot fire this weapon

Fan Fire. This revolver is specially modified to allow rapid emptying of the chamber. When you use your action to cast Eldritch Blast, you can use your bonus action to fan the hammer of the revolver and cast an additional Eldritch Blast on the same turn. You need a free hand to perform the Fan Fire technique and it can't be used again until the next dawn.

id-00029.name: The Last Word
id-00029.nonidentified: This exotic revolver is covered in ornate engravings and lavish gilding. As you hold it in your hand you can feel it thrum with barely contained arcane energy.
id-00029.rarity: Uncommon (Requires Attunement By A Warlock With Eldritch Blast)

description.p: The bladestaff is the signature weapon of the Silverstand Bladesingers. A long haft of fine wood supports a curved elven blade. Forged with techniques honed over tens of thousands of years, these blades are strong, sharp, and remarkably light. Each bladestaff is a masterpiece, and as a result this an expensive weapon, but few people ever have an opportunity to purchase one.
Guardian. The bearer gains a +2 bonus to initiative rolls if they aren't incapacitated. As long as the bearer is first in the initiative order, their speed increases by 5 feet.
Cursed: Crone's Disease. This weapon has been corrupted by evils of Dreadwood and must be cleansed.

Every night you are plagued by horrible visions and nightmares. As the corruptions spreads, your body begins to twist and warp - your nose may become hooked, your hands become claw-like, or your skin puckers and breaks out in boils. In addition, grass and plants around you start to wither and rot; if you make or handle food, it spoils; if you drink from a shared pitcher, it goes sour.

id-00034.name: Windrazor
id-00034.nonidentified: This weapon seems to sparkle with light

description.p: This stick of chalk, about four inches long, can be used indefinitely without getting any smaller.

id-00010.description:
Description
Image: Firecracker Crystals Table: Firecracker Crystals
As an action, you can throw one of these inch-long crystals against a solid surface to crack it apart. When broken in this way, a crystal releases the stored magic inside. The magic ends at the end of your turn and is entirely sensory.
A bag of the small crystals comes with 1d4+8 (10) crystals inside. Roll a number of d8 equal to the number of crystals in the bag and record each number rolled. Use these numbers to determine the kinds of crystals found in the bag using the table below.
id-00010.name: Firecracker Crystals
id-00010.nonidentified: A small bag decorated in bright patterns and mosaics

description.p: You can use your action to strike this hammer on an object and cast the "Mending" cantrip on it. The hammer's strike does not damage the object further.

id-00013.name: Hammer of Mending
id-00013.nonidentified: This hammer seems cast from bronze, and catches the light with a warm lustrous glow.

description.p: Any object slipped through this iron loop will have its gravity reversed for the next three seconds. This includes liquids.

id-00018.name: Loop of Gravity Reversal
id-00018.nonidentified: An iron loop with about a 2 inch diameter.

description.p: While wearing these gloves, you can hold and carry small nonmagical flames (such as that of a torch or candle) as if they were tangible objects and can sculpt them like clay. Once sculpted, a flame retains its form for 1 minute before returning to normal. A nonmagical flame carried in this way burns brightly for 1 hour before dying. If you drop or throw the carried flame, it immediately burns out.
While wearing these gloves, the wearer can snap their fingers and cast the produce flame spell (DC 11).

id-00019.name: Fireweaver Gloves
id-00019.nonidentified: A pair of fine leather gloves with intricate stitching resembling dancing flames

description.p: Once per long rest, when your roll a d20 and don't have advantage or disadvantage, you can instead choose to roll 3d20 and pick the middle (median) value of the three dice.

id-00021.name: Ring of Averages
id-00021.nonidentified: A delicately made ring consisting of three bands braided together - one silver, one gold, and one platinum

description.p: Whoever wears this white, loose shirt can jump one foot higher than their strength score would otherwise permit. The shirt also seems to constantly flow in a nonexistant sea breeze.

id-00023.name: Shirt of the Buccaneer
id-00023.nonidentified: This shirt looks like the simple garb a sailor would commonly wear. Closer inspection reveals finely detailed patterns around the hem.

id-00030.description:
Description
Image: Tiny Violin Rings Spell: Vicious Mockery
You can use this set of rings as a somatic component for vicious mockery instead of the required vocal component.
In addition, these rings allow you to cast viscious mockery a number of times up to your spellcasting modifer per day (minimum of 1).
id-00030.name: Tiny Violin Rings
id-00030.nonidentified: This set of twin rings plays a sad, sad melody when you rub the two fingers wearing them together.

description.p: When you hit a creature within 30 feet with a ranged attack using this weapon, you can choose for the harpoon to impale into the target.

You can use a bonus action to try and pull an impaled creature (that is no more than one size larger than you) towards you. Make a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, the target is pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line towards you. If your target succeeds, the harpoon detaches and returns to your hand.
In addition, if the target attempts to move more than 30 feet away from you, their speed is halved and they drag you along with them, unless you use a reaction to release the rope.
A target can detach the harpoon with an action.

id-00033.name: Whaler's Harpoon
id-00033.nonidentified: This barbed javelin is connected to a length of braided rope.

id-00020.description:
Description
Image: Potion of Dragon's Breath Spell: Dragon's Breath
After drinking this potion, you can immediately replicate the dragon's breath spell as if cast at second level.
id-00020.name: Potion of Dragon's Breath
id-00020.nonidentified: This bright blue potion is in a vial stoppered with a modified dragon's tooth.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the sanctuary spell for 1 hour.
If you make an attack or casts a harmful spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, the potion's effect ends.

id-00039.name: Potion of Sanctuary
id-00039.nonidentified: A vial of bright purple-pink liquid with a gold silk thread floating at the bottom.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) checks for 1 hour.

id-00042.name: Elixer of the Silver Tongue
id-00042.nonidentified: A small vial of mercury which glows softly when shaken

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the blur spell for 1 minute (no concentration required).

id-00043.name: Potion of Blurred Movement
id-00043.nonidentified: The volatile liquid in this potion appears to shift from blue to purple and back again.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to (Wisdom) Animal Handling checks for 1 hour.

id-00044.name: Elixer of the Shepherd
id-00044.nonidentified: A small vial of creamy tan liquid. Tufts of brown fur float on the surface.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks for 1 hour.

id-00045.name: Elixer of Falsehoods
id-00045.nonidentified: This vial contains a clear liquid that looks like water... except for the black smoke boiling off the surface.

description.p: When you drink this potion, all curses affecting you end. If the curse is caused by a magic item, the curse remains on the object, but the potion breaks the drinker's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded

id-00046.name: Elixer of Cleansing
id-00046.nonidentified: This ornate vial contains a pure white liquid that glows with a soft gold radiance

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Investigation) checks for 1 hour.

id-00047.name: Elixer of the Inquisitor
id-00047.nonidentified: A small vial of deep red liquid verging on black with small flakes of iron rust floating in it.

description.p: This flask contains a thin watery light-green oil. When shaken, translucent scales appear just beneath the surface.
This oil can coat one melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon deals an additional 1d4 poison damage.

id-00048.name: Oil of the Snake
id-00048.nonidentified: This flask contains a thin watery light-green oil. When shaken, translucent scales appear just beneath the surface.

description.p: The oil in this flask is coloured bright orange. Occasionally small sparks dance across the surface.

This oil can coat one melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon deals an additional 1d4 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this weapon ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

id-00050.name: Oil of Flames
id-00050.nonidentified: The oil in this flask is coloured bright orange. Occasionally small sparks dance across the surface.

description.p: This flask contains a thick green unguent. A yellow-green gas oozes out from the surface.
This oil can coat one melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon deals an additional 1d4 acid damage.

id-00051.name: Oil of Corrosion
id-00051.nonidentified: This flask contains a thick green unguent. A yellow-green gas oozes out from the surface

description.p: This flask contains a bright purple oil. Small arcs of electricity occasionally form on the surface.
This oil can coat one melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon deals an additional 1d4 lightning damage.

id-00052.name: Oil of Lightning
id-00052.nonidentified: This flask contains a bright purple oil. Small arcs of electricity occasionally form on the surface.

description.p: A flask of light blue oil. The surface of the flask is constantly covered in a layer of cold frost.
This oil can coat one melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated weapon deals an additional 1d4 cold damage.

id-00053.name: Oil of Frost
id-00053.nonidentified: A flask of light blue oil. The surface of the flask is constantly covered in a layer of cold frost.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Arcana) checks for 1 hour.

id-00054.name: Elixer of the Magus
id-00054.nonidentified: This liquid in this vial glows with a strange ultraviolet light

description.p: Iridescent bubbles constantly form on and float off the the surface of this thick viscous oil.

This oil can coat a single object with a surface area of up to 10 square feet that weighs 500 pounds or less. Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The object rises 5 feet into the air and floats there for 10 minutes. The object can be moved freely by physical labor, and continues to float in place for the duration.
When the potion's affect ends, the object floats gently to the ground.

id-00055.name: Oil of Levitation
id-00055.nonidentified: Iridescent bubbles constantly form on and float off the the surface of this thick viscous oil.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Nature) checks for 1 hour.

id-00059.name: Elixer of the Wilds
id-00059.nonidentified: A small vial of clear spring water with a single verdant leaf floating within.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Wisdom (Survival) checks for 1 hour.

id-00060.name: Elixer of the Tracker
id-00060.nonidentified: Small pebbles float within the blue-green liquid contained in this vial.

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain a +5 bonus to Wisdom (Insight) checks for 1 hour.

id-00061.name: Elixer of Acumen
id-00061.nonidentified: A small vial of bright golden liquid with minute crystals floating in it

description.p: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the mage armor spell.

id-00062.name: Potion of Arcane Armor
id-00062.nonidentified: A vial of brownish liquid with flecks of gold. A patch of cured leather sits at the bottom of the vial.

p.i: Natural selection? Nature selected me herself.

description.p: The wooden chain is reinforced with old, natural magic that responds to the wearer's reverent connection to nature. While wearing this armor, you gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Wisdom modifier (max 2) in addition to the armor's normal AC.

Medium armor offers more protection than light armor, but it also impairs movement more. If you wear medium armor, you add your Dexterity modifier, to a maximum of +2, to the base number from your armor type to determine your Armor Class.

Made of interlocking wooden rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

id-00006.name: Druidic Chain of the Unbroken Circle
id-00006.nonidentified: This magical chain shirt is crafted using strange wooden links enchanted by a militant circle of druids.
id-00006.rarity: Rare (Requires Attunement by a Druid or Ranger)

description.p: The cloak has 5 charges and regains all expended charges at dawn.

Once per turn you can make a leaping spin, causing the cloak to erupt in an inferno around you. The intensity of the spin is determined by your movement speed and the number of charges you expend - for every 10 feet of movement you sacrifice, you can expend an additional charge.

Creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 fire damage for every charge spent. Creatures that take damage from the cloak can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.
The DC for this feature is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.

id-00009.name: Fire Dervish Cloak
id-00009.nonidentified: Made of red silk and very fine leather, the hem of this flowing cloak appears to be made of embers that smoulder slightly and makes the sound of crackling fire when you walk.

id-00015.description:
Description
Image: Mageplate helm Spell: Shield
The helm has 4 charges and regains 1d4 expended charges each day at dawn. While wearing the cap, you can expend a charge to cast the shield spell. In addition, whenever you are the target of the mage armor spell, your base AC instead becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier.
id-00015.name: Mageplate Helm
id-00015.nonidentified: This pointed hat is fitted with chain and metal that have been enchanted with empowering abjuration magic
id-00015.rarity: Rare (Requires Attunement by a Wizard or Sorcerer)

description.p: This dense, roughly crafted metal ring seems to have an otherworldly pull on other metallic items.

While wearing the ring, you can spend an hour holding onto an object weighing no more than 25 pounds that is made of at least half metal. If the ring and metallic item are in contact for the full hour, they form a powerful and magically controllable magnetic bond. You can only have one item bound to the ring in this way at a time.
If the bound item is no more than 40 feet away from you and unobstructed, you can use your bonus action to magically pull it toward your outstretched hand at a speed of 20 feet per round.

If another creature or object is partially obstructing the path your bound item will take, the item moves at half its regular speed until it moves past the obstruction, bouncing harmlessly against the obstruction until it's able to pass by.

id-00024.name: Starmetal Ring
id-00024.nonidentified: This crude ring is made of a strange dull grey metal that you can't identify.

description.p: While wearing this ring

id-00035.name: Ring of the Seasons
id-00035.nonidentified: This simple wooden ring has the image of a tree carved into it
id-00035.rarity: Rare (requires attunement by an eladrin or other fey creature)

description.p: This light axe seems to soar through the air unto its targets. This weapon has the finesse property and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls made with the axe.
If the axe is within 30 feet of you, you can recall it to your hand as a bonus action.

id-00001.name: Axe Beak Tomahawk
id-00001.nonidentified: This slender axe is light in the hand, made from the remains of a slain Axe Beak and ornamented with a set of colorful feathers.

description.p: While wearing these boots, you can choose to jump once while in the air as if you'd leapt from solid ground. You can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow, and you treat all jumps made in this way as they were standing jumps. When leaping mid-air in this way, thin, cloudy wisps fly out from under your feet and immediately disappear.
The boots allow you to jump in this way once before they need to make contact with a solid surface again. Jumping in this way while falling prevents up to 20 feet of fall damage.

id-00005.name: Cloudwalker Boots
id-00005.nonidentified: These boots are made of finest leather dyed a soft shade of sky blue.

description.p: While you wear this necklace, you gan a swim speed equal to your walking speed, and can hold your breath for 1 hour. In addition, you can cast the jump spell using this necklace targetting only yourself. Once the Toadstone has been used to cast this spell, it can't do so again until the next dusk.

Curse. The Toadstone is cursed. Attunment to it curses you until you're targeted by the remove curse spell or similar magic. Removing the necklace fails to end the curse on you. While you're cursed, your skin is perpetually slightly wet and clammy, and you only have an appetite for insects and other grubs instead of the food you would normally enjoy eating.

id-00011.name: Toadstone
id-00011.nonidentified: A small jade carving of a frog dangles from a simple cord of leather

description.p: This drab pair of empty ceramic cylinders are magically linked. Each vessel is 3 inches in diameter and one foot tall.

Opening one of the vessel's lids and placing an item inside will magically teleport it to the second tube, making a quiet whoosh sound when it does. A very quiet thud can be heard when receiving an item.

A tube cannot hold more than 2 pounds of materials at any time, and both lids must be closed for the items to be teleported. Items can only be sent if the two tubes are on the same plane of existence. A creature cannot be sent through the tubes.
If one of the cylinders in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

id-00017.name: Numat’s Trick Tubes
id-00017.nonidentified: A pair of drab, empty ceramic cylinders.

description.p: This icy shield has two charges, which recharge at dawn. When a creature you can see damages you with a melee weapon attack, you may expend a charge as a reaction to deal 2d4 cold damage back to the attacker. In addition, you gain that same amount of damage as temporary hit points for up to one minute.

id-00022.name: Shield of Agathys
id-00022.nonidentified: The simple buckler is encased in a thick layer of permanent ice, even in the hottest weather.

description.p: While holding this dagger, the bearer gains a +1 bonus to Wisdom (Medicine) checks.
Special: This weapon uses your Wisdom, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

id-00026.name: Surgeon's scalpel
id-00026.nonidentified: The pommel of this thin blade contains a small crystal sphere within which a deep red liquid sloshes about. The liquid glows slightly when the dagger is held.

description.p: While holding this dagger, the bearer gains a +1 bonus to Wisdom (Medicine) checks.
Special: This weapon uses your Wisdom, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
When this dagger is stabbed into a creature, they first take damage as per normal, then are healed for 1d8 + WIS hitpoints. This property can only be used in combat.

id-00027.name: Surgeon's scalpel (post stab)
id-00027.nonidentified: The pommel of this thin blade contains a small crystal sphere within which a deep red liquid sloshes about. The liquid glows slightly when the dagger is held.

description.p: When charcoal, incense and herbs are burned within this brazier, hidden runes on the bowl glow with arcane light and the components are consumed in a sudden burst of flames. Once per day, when the brazier is used to summon a Familiar, the ritual is accomplished in one action.
If a familiar was summoned in this way with the brazier, once per short rest the familiar may use its reaction to dismiss itself insead of being reduced to 0 hit points.

id-00031.name: Ivellios' Minute Brazier
id-00031.nonidentified: The brazier is a roughly hewn granite bowl with a concave brass insert.

description.p: When you hit a creature with this dart, you can choose to immediately cast the hunter's mark spell at 1st level targeting the creature. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

id-00032.name: Tracking Dart
id-00032.nonidentified: A slender dart with bright red fletchings.

description.p: A lightweight suit of armor, favored by spies, assassins, and wealthy criminals. Shadow Hunt armor passively dampens sound in its immediate proximity and camouflages the wearer.
You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while wearing this armor.

id-00036.name: Shadow Hunt Leather
id-00036.nonidentified: The suit of armor is made from finely wrought leather stained a dark black.

description.p: While wearing this glove, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause one item held in your hand to disappear into an extradimensional space. The item can weigh no more than 20 pounds and must be able to be held with one hand.
As a bonus action, you can snap your fingers, causing an item stored within the glove to appear in your hand. An item stored within the glove is held in stasis.

id-00037.name: Glove of Storing
id-00037.nonidentified: A single glove of thick leather. A metal plate with an engraved rune is embedded in the back of the glove.

description.p: This ring is part of a pair and is often given a sign of commitment between friends or lovers.

Life Bond. Once per day as an action, you can form a magical bond with another creature wearing the paired ring. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The bond ends after 1 hour, if either of the rings are removed, if you drop to 0 hit points, or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. You can also dismiss the bond as an action.

id-00038.name: Ring of Bonding
id-00038.nonidentified: This granite ring is engraved with images of link hands forming a chain.

id-00001.result: Red. Releases a plume of harmless flame 5 feet tall.
Orange. Releases a small flash of bright light in a 5 foot radius and dim light for another 5 feet, followed by the smell of spices and citrus.
Yellow. Releases small spiraling motes of energy that fizz and fly about in a 5-foot radius.
Green. Releases a cloud of colorful verdant smoke that fills a 5-foot sphere that smells both foul and sweet at once.
Blue. Releases a series of comically large bubbles that float outward from the point of impact in a 5-foot radius.
Purple. Releases the sound of music. The song is random, and plays only enough to make it recognizable as music.
White. Releases a dazzling display of sparkling glitter in a 5-foot radius from the point of impact.
Black. Releases a mystery effect. Roll on the table again when using this crystal to determine its effect. If you roll an 8, roll again.
